resources.string: Use GPS of the current location
"Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."
Responsibilities: Serve community (educate and treat), time commitment, attend trainings, represent LG \n\nFree time to spend (2hrs p/day). Empathetic. Wants to serve community

Never worked in the community, no expectations about the work/or worked in the community but disliked it (1). 

Never worked in the community, but looking forward to clearly articulated aspects/worked in the community but didn’t like certain aspects (2-3). 

Experience working in the community, enjoyed work (4-5)

Cant/won’t attend unless paid for (1) 

Will attend if reimbursed (3) 

Will attend, no problem (5)

Never sold anything (1) 

Sells small amounts less than 10,000 UGX p/mon e.g. charcoal (2-3) 

Currently successfully selling branded products e.g. solar/stoves etc. X UGX p/mon (4-5)

No ability to invest capital – uses it to cover personal costs (1-2) 

Invest 50% capital (3)
 

Invest all capital (4-5)

Has no interpersonal skills e.g. no eye contact, speaks too softly, nervous (1-2) 

Engages the interviewee but provides wrong information, good eye conduct, speaks well etc. (3) 

Engages interviewee, provides correct information (4-5)

Plans to leave area (1) 

Plans to leave, or upcoming significant commitment e.g. currently pregnant, chaotic home life, no child care options etc. (2) 

Can commit required time amount but vague responses (3) 

Can commit, specific examples of how she will manage her affairs and time(4-5)

Cannot read or interpret (1) 

Reads and interprets at very basic level (2) 

Reads and interprets at minimum level (3) 

Reads and interprets with few mistakes (4) 

Reads and interprets with no mistakes (5)
What do you think the responsibilities of a Community Health Promoter are? What makes you think that you can carry out these responsibilities?
Have you worked in the community in your area? With which organizations? What did you like about this work? What did you dislike?
An Organization invites you for a 3-day training offering you free meals, health education and tools to use but doesn’t provide daily transport of 10,000/=. Will you be able to attend the training?
What do you do for a living now? Have you ever sold goods or services (give an example of goods and of services, i.e. charcoal and tailoring, etc.)? What did you do to improve sales?
You have made profits of 50,000/= in 3 days from capital of 200,000/= and you realize you need to invest more capital to earn more profits. How much do you think you can invest?

Role Play: As a CHP, you will be encouraging your friends and neighbors to adopt healthy living behaviors, such as sleeping under an bed net, washing their hands and going to the local Health Centre for ante-natal check-ups. Engage the interviewee in a role-play, where she is a CHP and is trying to convince the interviewer, playing the role of a neighbor, to sleep under a bed net.

How do you usually spend your day? What’s your plan in the coming 3 months? If you were to be taken by Living Goods, how much time would you dedicate to Living Goods: how many days a week? How many hours a day? We cannot allow children to training – do you have someone to care for them? Can you commit to training weeks?
DO NOT READ THIS QUESTION ALOUD: Does this candidate have any conditions that would prevent them from being a successful CHP (e.g. pregnancy, advanced disabilities)?
General Comment (be objective, state any unique feature observed, if any);
Ability to read and interpret English
